title.native: 陰の実力者になりたくて！

description:
Some people just aren’t suited to playing the part of the flashy, in-your-face hero or the dastardly, mustache-twirling villain with larger-than-life panache. Instead, they operate in the shadows and pull the strings of society through wit and cleverness. That’s the role Cid wants to play when he’s transported to another world. Cid spins a yarn or three and becomes the unlikely leader of the underground Shadow Garden organization that fights against a menacing cult (which he totally made up). However, there’s a catch even his wild imagination didn’t see coming: the cult he concocted actually exists, and they’re beyond displeased that his power fantasy just got in the way of their evil plans!

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: To Be a Power in the Shadows!
ชีวิตไม่ต้องเด่น ขอแค่เป็นเทพในเงา

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__[Website](http://www.oxt-music.com/)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ Rock (Digital Rock), J-POP, Anison

__Introduction:__
OxT is a Japanese duo consisting of Masayoshi Ooishi and Tomohiro Oshima (better known as Tom-H@ck), who are under record labels Pony Canyon and KADOKAWA, affiliated with FMF Corporation. They originally collaborated under the name Tom-H@ck ft. Masayoshi Ooishi, but was later changed in 2015 to OxT when they went from a collaboration to a unit.

__Biography:__
The duo first came to life when Masayoshi was selected during an audition for the anime "Ace of Diamond", where Tom-H@ck was in-charge of the opening theme song. In a recording session, they eventually landed on a song titled "GO EXCEED!!", which Masayoshi performed and Tomohiro produced.

After this appearance, they would go on for about a year and a half under the name "Tom-H@ck. featuring Masayoshi Ooishi", before Tomohiro fronted to Masayoshi about how the collaboration didn't feel quite right with him only credited as a featuring artist. As a continuation of this, and during their rise of popularity, Tomohiro made a suggestion to Masayoshi asking if they should start a unit, which Masayoshi responded that he always intended to do so. The unit was officially announced under the name OxT on January 18, 2015.

__Members:__
- [Masayoshi Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/123728) (大石昌良, オーイシマサヨシ) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [Tomohiro Oshima](https://anilist.co/staff/107596) (大嶋文博, Tom-H@ck) – vocalist, in-charge of composition and arrangement

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/OxT), edited)

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Hiroshi Nakamura is an animation producer and production manager.
